content:
ListSortDescriptionCollection Class

Definition

Represents a collection of ListSortDescription objects.

In this Article

public class ListSortDescriptionCollection : System.Collections.IList
Inheritance
System.Object
ListSortDescriptionCollection

Inherited Members

Equals(Object)
Equals(Object,Object)
GetHashCode()
GetType()
MemberwiseClone()
ReferenceEquals(Object,Object)
ToString()

Remarks

The ListSortDescriptionCollection class is used by the IBindingListView interface.

The ListSortDescriptionCollection is read-only once constructed.

Constructors

ListSortDescriptionCollection()

Initializes a new instance of the ListSortDescriptionCollection class.

public ListSortDescriptionCollection ();

Remarks

The ListSortDescriptionCollection is read-only once constructed.

ListSortDescriptionCollection(ListSortDescription[])

Initializes a new instance of the ListSortDescriptionCollection class with the specified array of ListSortDescription objects.

public ListSortDescriptionCollection (System.ComponentModel.ListSortDescription[] sorts);
sorts
ListSortDescription[]

The array of ListSortDescription objects to be contained in the collection.

Remarks

The ListSortDescriptionCollection is read-only once constructed.

Example

Properties

Count

Gets the number of items in the collection.

public int Count { get; }
Value
Int32

The number of items in the collection.

Item(Int32)

Gets or sets the specified ListSortDescription.

public System.ComponentModel.ListSortDescription this[int index] { get; set; }
index
Int32

The zero-based index of the ListSortDescription to get or set in the collection.

Value
ListSortDescription

The ListSortDescription with the specified index.

Exceptions
InvalidOperationException

An item is set in the ListSortDescriptionCollection, which is read-only.

Remarks

The ListSortDescriptionCollection is read-only once constructed and will throw an InvalidOperationException if you attempt to set an item.

Methods

Contains(Object)

Determines if the ListSortDescriptionCollection contains a specific value.

public bool Contains (object value);
value
System.Object

The Object to locate in the collection.

Returns
Boolean

true if the Object is found in the collection; otherwise, false.

CopyTo(Array,Int32)

Copies the contents of the collection to the specified array, starting at the specified destination array index.

public void CopyTo (Array array, int index);
array
Array

The destination array for the items copied from the collection.

index
Int32

The index of the destination array at which copying begins.

IndexOf(Object)

Returns the index of the specified item in the collection.

public int IndexOf (object value);
value
System.Object

The Object to locate in the collection.

Returns
Int32

The index of value if found in the list; otherwise, -1.

Explicit Interface Implementations

ICollection.IsSynchronized

Gets a value indicating whether access to the collection is thread safe.

bool System.Collections.ICollection.IsSynchronized { get; }
Returns
Boolean

truein all cases.

Remarks

This property always returns true, because once constructed, the collection is read-only. This member is an explicit interface member implementation. It can be used only when the ListSortDescriptionCollection instance is cast to an ICollection interface.

ICollection.SyncRoot

Gets the current instance that can be used to synchronize access to the collection.

object System.Collections.ICollection.SyncRoot { get; }
Returns
System.Object

The current instance of the ListSortDescriptionCollection.

Remarks

This implementation returns the current instance of the ListSortDescriptionCollection, because this collection, once constructed, does not allow public access to the underlying list.

For more information on the ICollection.SyncRoot method, see the SyncRoot property.

IEnumerable.GetEnumerator()

Gets a IEnumerator that can be used to iterate through the collection.

System.Collections.IEnumerator IEnumerable.GetEnumerator ();
Returns
IEnumerator

An IEnumerator that can be used to iterate through the collection.

IList.Add(Object)

Adds an item to the collection.

int IList.Add (object value);
value
System.Object

The item to add to the collection.

Returns
Int32

The position into which the new element was inserted.

Exceptions
InvalidOperationException

In all cases.

Remarks

Because the ListSortDescriptionCollection class implements the System.Collections.IList interface, it must have an IList.Add method. However, because the ListSortDescriptionCollection class represents a read-only collection, adding items to the collection is an invalid operation.

IList.Clear()

Removes all items from the collection.

void IList.Clear ();
Exceptions
InvalidOperationException

In all cases.

Remarks

Because the ListSortDescriptionCollection class implements the System.Collections.IList interface, it must have a IList.Clear method. However, because the ListSortDescriptionCollection class represents a read-only collection, clearing items from the collection is an invalid operation.

IList.Insert(Int32,Object)

Inserts an item into the collection at a specified index.

void IList.Insert (int index, object value);
index
Int32

The zero-based index of the ListSortDescription to get or set in the collection

value
System.Object

The item to insert into the collection.

Exceptions
InvalidOperationException

In all cases.

Remarks

Because the ListSortDescriptionCollection class implements the System.Collections.IList interface, it must have a IList.Insert method. However, because the ListSortDescriptionCollection class represents a read-only collection, inserting items into the collection is an invalid operation.

IList.IsFixedSize

Gets a value indicating whether the collection has a fixed size.

bool System.Collections.IList.IsFixedSize { get; }
Returns
Boolean

true in all cases.

Remarks

The collection is read-only once constructed and will, therefore, always have a fixed size.

IList.IsReadOnly

Gets a value indicating whether the collection is read-only.

bool System.Collections.IList.IsReadOnly { get; }
Returns
Boolean

truein all cases.

Remarks

The ListSortDescriptionCollection is read-only once constructed. A collection that is read-only does not allow the addition, removal, or modification of elements after the collection is created.

IList.Item(Int32)

Gets the specified ListSortDescription.

object System.Collections.IList.Item[int index] { get; set; }
index
Int32

The zero-based index of the ListSortDescription to get in the collection

Returns
System.Object

The ListSortDescription with the specified index.

IList.Remove(Object)

Removes the first occurrence of an item from the collection.

void IList.Remove (object value);
value
System.Object

The item to remove from the collection.

Exceptions
InvalidOperationException

In all cases.

Remarks

Because the ListSortDescriptionCollection class implements the System.Collections.IList interface, it must have a IList.Remove method. However, because the ListSortDescriptionCollection class represents a read-only collection, removing items from the collection is an invalid operation.

IList.RemoveAt(Int32)

Removes an item from the collection at a specified index.

void IList.RemoveAt (int index);
index
Int32

The zero-based index of the ListSortDescription to remove from the collection

Exceptions
InvalidOperationException

In all cases.

Remarks

Because the ListSortDescriptionCollection class implements the System.Collections.IList interface, it must have a IList.RemoveAt method. However, because the ListSortDescriptionCollection class represents a read-only collection, removing items from the collection is an invalid operation.
